name: Cookie Cups
description: Slightly toasted around the edges but still soft in the middle, these cookie cups made from refrigerated cookie dough will add a whole new level of fun to your next ice cream sundae bar! They can easily be made ahead of time, just fill with ice cream and drizzle with chocolate sauce for a perfect dessert.
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) package refrigerated chocolate chip cookie dough

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly spray a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray.
Divide dough into sixteen 2-tablespoon portions. Place 12 portions into the prepared muffin tin and press into the bottom and about halfway up each cup. Reserve remaining 4 portions of dough.

Bake in the preheated oven for 9 minutes. Remove from the oven and lightly press down in the center with the large end of a wooden spoon or a shot glass to form a cup shape. Return to oven and bake until golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes more. Remove from the oven and press the center down gently as before. Allow to cool completely in the pan, about 15 minutes, before removing with a small offset spatula or knife.
Repeat process with remaining 4 cookie dough portions.

review.reviewBody:
I had some trouble with my first batch, which I measured out so that I used 2 T of dough for each cup.  They ended up being a bit thin-walled and undercooked so I couldn't get the out of the muffin tin without them breaking up.

The second batch, I added more dough until the cup sides seemed thick enough and ended up baking them for 21 minutes total.  This batch came right out of the tin after cooling and were a big hit with our guests.  If you think there isn't enough cookie dough when you put them in the tins, I recommend adding more until it looks right to you.  This is a fun idea!
